question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Given that $13^{-1} \equiv 29 \pmod{47}$, find $34^{-1} \pmod{47}$, as a residue modulo 47.  (Give a number between 0 and 46, inclusive.)
inference:
$$\begin{split} 13^{-1} &\equiv 29 \pmod{47} \\\ 13 \cdot 29 &\equiv 1 \pmod{47} \\\  34 \cdot 29 &\equiv 2 \pmod{47} \\\  34 \cdot 29 \cdot 29 &\equiv 2 \cdot 29 \pmod{47}  \\\ 34^{-1} &\equiv 20 \pmod{47} \end{split}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{20}$. I hope it is correct.
